SETUP: You wake up, grab your phone, and immediately dive into numbers. Leads generated. Conversion rates. Pipeline metrics. You're doing everything right on paper, but you still feel burned out and disconnected from why you started. [ON-SCREEN: BURNED OUT?] Sound familiar? You're grinding harder than ever but feeling less fulfilled than when you began.

INSIGHT: Connie Mahan runs an independent brokerage in Central Florida, trains agents, and was named REALTOR of the Year. [ON-SCREEN: 25 YEARS IN BUSINESS] Every morning, she reminds herself of this: "We are so lucky to get to do what we do ‚Äî help people honestly and ethically make the largest decision of their life." [ON-SCREEN: "IT'S A PRIVILEGE"] She told me about a first-generation buyer who was terrified, convinced she'd be rejected. Connie walked her through every step ‚Äî pre-approval, inspection, closing. That buyer cried at the settlement table. Connie said, "That's when I realized this isn't a job. It's a privilege."

REFRAME: Most burned-out agents aren't doing too much ‚Äî they're feeling too little. When real estate becomes purely transactional, you lose what made you good at it. The secret isn't better systems. It's never forgetting why this work matters.

CTA: "When's the last time you texted a past client just to check how they're loving their home?"

CLOSE: "See you next time."
